data.title: Who was Roberta Taylor and how did she die? EastEnders and The Bill star's cause of death explained
data.meta_description: ROBERTA Taylor has died at the age of 76 on July 6 2024, following a struggle with health issues for some months.After appearing on our screens in 197
data.text:
ROBERTA Taylor has died at the age of 76 on July 6 2024, following a struggle with health issues for some months.

After appearing on our screens in 1979, she went on to have a celebrated career in TV before passing away in 2024.

Who was Roberta Taylor?

Roberta Taylor was an icon on the small screen, appearing in some of the biggest British shows.

She was famed for playing Irene Raymond in EastEnders and bobby Gina Gold in The Bill.

Roberta had a true cockney upbringing.

She was born on February 26, 1948, in Plaistow, East London, before moving to the Isle of Dogs when she was young.

Both her parents were bus conductors, but she was raised by her mother, grandmother and aunties after her dad, Robert, left home when she was young.

Roberta credited her upbringing with the strong woman she grew up to be.

What was Roberta Taylor's cause of death?

Roberta died on July 6, 2024, from pneumonia, following a fall several months earlier.

The 76-year-old had also suffered with emphysema, caused by smoking for many years.

She is survived by her son, Elliot, from her first marriage to Victor Taylor, as well as her second husband, Peter Guinness, and granddaughter.

BBC EastEnders paid tribute to her on Twitter, saying she "made an impact on screen from the moment she arrived in Albert Square".

The post added: "Roberta will be remembered fondly by everyone that worked with her. Our love & thoughts go to her family & friends."

What TV shows did Roberta Taylor star in?

Roberta was known for playing tough, no-nonsense characters that audiences fell in love with.

She is known for her TV work, but did star in a number of films including The Witches in 1990 and The Turnaround in 1995.

EastEnders (1997-2000)

For many, their first introduction to Roberta was when she played Irene Raymond in EastEnders.

She joined the show in 1997.

Irene was a bold, matriarchal character, with a wide range of dramatic plot lines, involving new age trends and younger men.

One of her biggest and most scandalous plot lines involved an affair with Troy Harvey, who was almost half her age.

This liaison put a strain on her marriage to Terry, who eventually gave her the money and a car to leave.

Irene drove off into the sun and to freedom in Alicante, Spain, leaving Roberta free to explore other characters beyond Walford Square.

The Bill (2002-2008)

After leaving EastEnders in 2000, Roberta joined ITV’s The Bill in 2002.

She took on the role of Gina Gold, a hard-drinking, tough-talking Inspector at Sun Hill police station.

Her character tackled some hard-hitting plot lines, including her own character’s arrest for drink driving and a long-time rivalry with arch-villain Irene Radford, played by the late Lynda Bellingham.

After the kidnap of the fan-favourite character Dale Smith, known as “Smithy”, Gina finally decided to quit the force.

Shakespeare & Hathaway

Roberta continued to act after leaving The Bill in 2008.

She starred in BBC drama Luther, wrote a novel, and appeared in several plays.

In 2018 she joined the cast of Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators as Gloria Fonteyn, a costume shop owner.

Gloria is pals with the investigators' sidekick Sebastian.

Roberta left the show in 2022.

Who was Roberta Taylor's husband Peter Guinness?

Roberta married her second husband, Peter Guinness, in 1996 after many years of dating.

The couple met at the Glasgow Citizens Theatre where she worked from 1980 until 1992.

Like Roberta, Peter is a star on TV and stage.

He appeared in a number of blockbusters including in Alien in 1992 and Sleepy Hollow in 1999.

Peter played Ray Sykes in Coronation Street and in 2024 starred as Sir George Chapman in ITV drama Red Eye.

The couple even appeared on screen together on The Bill, with Peter playing Gina Gold's lover.

The couple did not have any children together.
